oai_dc:dc.dc:title: PeeWee's Saloon on Beale
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color image reproduction of watercolor painting of PeeWee’s Saloon.

“Goodwyn Institute -- May 17 1957 -- Institute -- Birthplace of the ‘Blues’ -- Beale Street Memphis -- It was in a back corner of Pee Wee’s Place on a night in 1909 that W.C. Handy tuned up his band and wailed out the first ‘Blues’ ever to be written. He’d written it for a hot political campaign and named it the ‘Mr. Crump’ song. Mr. Crump won the election and Handy rode on his song from Beale to Broadway. Later changed to the ‘Memphis Blues,’ a flood of rhythm went pulsating across the country, to Paris, to Singapore. W.C. Handy had given to the world the ‘Blues’ … the child born of his genius in a back corner of PeeWee’s Place on Beale Street.”
